summary: A three-wheeled vehicle abruptly appears from the right side of the road and cuts directly into the path of the dashcam vehicle, creating a hazardous situation.
actions: The dashcam vehicle is proceeding forward on a multi-lane road. A three-wheeled vehicle, carrying two individuals, suddenly moves from the right side of the road into the main traffic lane, directly in front of the dashcam vehicle.
characters: Driver of the dashcam vehicle (unseen), driver and passenger of the three-wheeled vehicle, other drivers in traffic, pedestrians.
key_objects: Dashcam vehicle, three-wheeled vehicle (motorized rickshaw/cargo bike), road, pedestrian crossing, surrounding buildings, other cars.
key_actions: The three-wheeled vehicle performs a sudden and aggressive cut-in maneuver. This behavior is identified as 'ghost probing' because the vehicle appears abruptly from a less visible area (the right side/shoulder of the road, acting as a blind spot relative to the forward view) and immediately cuts into the active traffic lane, forcing the dashcam vehicle to react to avoid a collision. This creates a dangerous situation due to the unexpected and close-proximity intrusion.
next_action: The autonomous driving system (or human driver) of the dashcam vehicle would likely initiate emergency braking or evasive steering to prevent a collision with the three-wheeled vehicle. The three-wheeled vehicle continues to cross the road.
